channel.title: Moparscape Modeling Contest!
channel.description:
I've been given permission by Frell to host this competition, the same rules and regulations apply to this one as the previous competitions.
DO NOT post unless it is your model entry, no flaming or spamming.
Contest Closes On: June 9, 2013
[b]Placement[/b] 1st. - 2nd. - 3rd. -
[b]Top Three(no specific order)[/b] 1. 2. 3.
[b]Model Requirements: Runescape Gods - Any model relating to this topic[/b]
[b]Rules[/b] 1. Any model posted must be made by you. 2. You may post up to TWO models. 3. Multiple Views Required, as well as a render. 4. Wire frame mandatory. We do judge the model based on the Polygon Flow. 5. NO SUB-SURFACING/Smoothing, we want to see YOUR Skill, not the "Subsurface/Smooth" tools skills. 6. Anyone posting another persons work will be disqualified and banned from current/future participation. 7. Do not just trace a model, reference images are ok. Those who trace an image will be disadvantaged against those who did not. 8. No previously posted models. 9. Do NOT post/release the model before the contest winner is announced. 10. You can only win the contest every second third time so that others have a chance. 11. No textures. Every program has different texturing capabilities and I feel it is an unfair advantage to those using more professional programs than Metasequoia. 12. NO RECOLORS! The model cannot be a model which in any way, is not yours. You can enter them, but your model won't be considered. 13. Models can be either triangulated or quads, but you will need a before and after shot for triangulated models.
To Clear the Polygon Limit disputes up: 1 000 Quads 2 000 Tri. *1 000Quads = 2 000 Triangulated poly.
[b]How The Model's Are Judged[/b]
The Point system will be used to judge the Top Three models only, but this system applies to all models.
[b]How its marked User's Score:[/b]
1.Appearance 25 Points /25 2.Polygon Flow 20 Points /20 3.Unique Style 15 Points /15 4.Use of Primitives 10 Points /10 5.Overall Appearance 10 Points /10 6.Proportion 10 Points /10 7.Detail 10 Points /10
I know by now your wondering, alright so what is the prize? As the winner of the model contest, your model will be stickied in the section up until the next contest winner is announced. I am also looking into a badge to be given to the winner, but that is not permanent (will be removed at the next competition).
[b]Judges CANNOT enter.[/b]
[b]Judges[/b] 1. Amy_webb 2. The Wanderer 3. SilentCJ
[size=12pt][b]Notice:[/b] Competitions will be held every 6 months after this, each being based on a seasonal event or holiday which takes place within the season it falls under. E.g. the next competition following this may be based on Christmas. This means that the winner of each competition will hold their badge for 6 months before it is given to the new winner. Good luck. :) [/size]

item.title: Moparscape Modeling Contest!
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

My post was pretty generic however most of points were either not aimed at you or misunderstood by you.

“You’ll find that all 3 judges have actually been involved in model before, we’ve watched the community and what it can achieve and we base it of that.” = irrelevant
" It is like going into an exam where there are 3 examiners separate to your school system, they won’t mark you based on what your school average is but on what the state expects." Actually, they do to an extent; in Britain at least (Standard grade, Higher etc: hints in the name - it’s not done school by school but on a larger scale, cba explaining).
“That is as about how simple i can put it.” = irrelevant
“Our marking is not based on what is put forth to us, it is based off of what we know about modeling and the uses of it.” = captain obvious
“For example, in my judgement of Hadlich, i put a 1/10 for primitive usage because he actually doesn’t know what they are and didn’t use them.” = Your just saying what I said should be done in a different way than I did (it may not be obvious but the whole example of my scoring; what do you think that is based on?)

My post is pretty bad, I just felt like letting you know the main three things (I’ll restate them if not obvious):

  1. I’ve either not made what I intended to portray obvious or you have misunderstood.
  2. You were not the person I had talked about at all (did you mark anyone as zero in any area for an example?)
  3. Your just re-iterating something I’ve said in another way or it seems that way to myself.

Finally, I know my post is a bit rude but it’s like that because I’m too lazy to type it up properly; no offence is meant by this post.

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape Modeling Contest!
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

You’ll find that all 3 judges have actually been involved in model before, we’ve watched the community and what it can achieve and we base it of that. It is like going into an exam where there are 3 examiners separate to your school system, they won’t mark you based on what your school average is but on what the state expects. That is as about how simple i can put it. Our marking is not based on what is put forth to us, it is based off of what we know about modeling and the uses of it. For example, in my judgement of Hadlich, i put a 1/10 for primitive usage because he actually doesn’t know what they are and didn’t use them. Now, is that not fair based of this community? I feel like it is fair based of the general understanding of what modeling is and it properties.

Thank you to everyone who was involved, and those who watched the contest over the weeks. Though this one was unsuccessful, i will be hosting another around an upcoming seasonal event in a few months time. So, with this, i would appreciate it if those who wish to enter into the next contest get practicing and thinking about that.

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape Modeling Contest!
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

0/10 = No submission, unfinished etc…
1/10 =Awful, truly trash worthy.
2/10 = Very aweful
3/10 Very bad
4/10 =bad
5/10 = average
6/10 = Slightly above average
7/10 = good
8/10 Very good
9/10 = Very impressive
10/10 = Brilliant/Near perfect

I’m not sure how what’s good in modelling etc, however I believe your marking is pretty harsh considering the forum you are on.
I’m not saying that compared to other places that the work here is awful nor good, I’m just saying the grading should be done with what community your on in mind. You don’t tell a five year old there picture is bad compared to twenty year old artists drawings, do you?

I don’t believe anyone deserves a 0/10 (I’m just generalizing it as 0/10) in any areas as long as something is provided which can be marked in that area. I know nothing about modelling, I’m just basing this on the marking done; not on the models.
P-PS (all in all is a way saying finally, hence why I said P-PS) I want to restate I know nothing about modelling so some of my points may not suit the situation I’ve presented them in so those points should be disregarded.

Read full topic

Pretty harsh judging here (runs away).

hows it harsh
[/quote]
because[/quote]
If you believe the judging to be harsh, then take it up with the judge in question rather then just stating (without reason) that the judging was harsh. In all fairness, i marked the models based on what was presented. This is so the results were accurate, and i’m sure CJ did the same.
